response.summary: A 4-day safe and easy Venice itinerary for budget-conscious college students on their first international trip, emphasizing pickpocket avoidance, reliable transport, low-risk areas, and free/cheap activities.
assumptions: 4-day trip duration with flexible dates in shoulder season (e.g., spring or fall) to avoid peak crowds and heat.
Daily budget approx. €50-70 per person excluding accommodation and flights, focusing on walking and affordable vaporetto passes.
Accommodation in safe, budget-friendly neighborhood like Cannaregio (approx. €40-60/night).
Solo or small group travel; basic fitness level for walking on uneven bridges.
EU entry rules followed; no mobility issues.
response.uncertainty_notes: Vaporetto schedules, high water (acqua alta) risks, crowd levels, and prices for passes/food/activities can change seasonally or with inflation; some free sights may have timed entry queues. Verify closer to dates.
next_steps: Book round-trip flights and budget hostel/Airbnb in Cannaregio or Dorsoduro (approx. €40-60/night).
Purchase 72-hour Venezia Unica rolling pass (approx. €45; check current price) for unlimited vaporetto rides.
Download offline maps (e.g., Google Maps), Citymapper app, and get travel insurance with theft coverage.
Pack comfortable shoes, portable charger, and anti-theft bag.
verification_steps: Check ACTV.it for current vaporetto timetables and lines.
Monitor Comune.Venezia.it for acqua alta alerts and pathway closures.
Confirm hours for key sights on official sites like Basilicasanmarco.it.
Review U.S. State Dept or equivalent travel advisories for Italy pickpocketing risks.
Check VeneziaUnica.it for current transport pass prices and options.

payload.title: 4-Day Safe Venice Itinerary: Easy & Budget-Friendly for First-Timers

trip_days.summary: Arrival, safe settling in Cannaregio, and gentle orientation walk to avoid jet lag and scams.

items.activity: Arrive at Venice Santa Lucia station or airport bus; take vaporetto Line 1 to Cannaregio (buy pass at ticket machine). Watch belongings.
items.location: Santa Lucia Station to Ca' d'Oro stop

items.activity: Check into accommodation; rest and store bags securely.
Easy walk along Strada Nova: People-watch, grab cheap cicchetti (Venetian tapas, approx. €2-5) at a bar. Stay aware of surroundings.
Visit Jewish Ghetto (free exterior views); learn history via free info boards. Low crowds, safe area.
Dinner: Affordable pizza or panini (approx. €8-10). Early night to acclimate.

trip_days.summary: Core sights in San Marco via vaporetto: Focus on free areas, timed visits to beat lines and pickpockets.

items.activity: Vaporetto to San Marco; use shoulder-to-shoulder rule in crowds.
items.location: Vaporetto Line 1 to San Marco Vallaresso

items.activity: St. Mark's Square: Free views of Basilica exterior, Campanile, Doge's Palace. Avoid unofficial guides.
Lunch: Tramezzini sandwiches from bar (approx. €5). Sit away from tourists.
Bridge of Sighs exterior view; vaporetto under it for photos. Safe from boat.
Return vaporetto to Cannaregio; relax at a square with gelato (approx. €3).

trip_days.summary: Rialto and quieter canals: Market vibes, safe shopping tips, avoid overpriced traps.

items.activity: Vaporetto to Rialto Bridge; early to dodge peak pickpocket hours.
Rialto Market: Free browsing of fresh produce/seafood; photo ops. Haggle politely if buying.
Lunch: Street food like arancini (approx. €4).
Wander safe alleys to Santa Maria Gloriosa dei Frari (church entry approx. €3, optional). Note emergency paths.
Vaporetto Grand Canal cruise back; people-watch safely onboard.

trip_days.summary: Relaxed final day in Dorsoduro: Artsy, less touristy, easy departure prep.

items.activity: Vaporetto to Accademia; stroll Zattere promenade (free, scenic, safe).
Peggy Guggenheim Collection exterior/gardens (free views) or nearby churches. Budget souvenir hunt at local shops.
Lunch: Picnic from market (approx. €6).
Return to Cannaregio; pack and review safety tips (e.g., keep passport copy).
Vaporetto/train to airport/station. Safe travels!

prompt: Return JSON only. Include summary, assumptions, uncertainty_notes, next_steps, verification_steps, payload_type, payload. Safety and travel advisories require verification_steps. Create a decision tree for travel safety in Brazil. Include verification_steps. JSON only. No prose.

response.summary: Decision tree for evaluating travel safety risks in Brazil, covering crime, health, natural hazards, and precautions. Guides users to personalized safety recommendations.
assumptions: User is a typical tourist with standard precautions; based on general patterns up to 2023 (e.g., high urban crime, seasonal health risks). Does not account for individual health vulnerabilities or real-time events.
response.uncertainty_notes: Crime rates, health outbreaks (e.g., dengue, Zika), and political instability can change rapidly. Official advisories supersede this tree.
next_steps: Follow tree recommendations, obtain travel insurance, get required vaccinations, share itinerary with contacts, and use ride-sharing apps over street taxis.
verification_steps: Check your government's travel advisory (e.g., US State Dept Level 2-4 for Brazil regions).
Review WHO/CDC health notices for Brazil (vaccinations, outbreaks).

Cross-check weather/ natural disaster risks via Brazil's INMET or equivalent.

root.question: Have you verified current travel advisories and health alerts (per verification_steps)?

yes.question: Planning to visit high-crime urban areas (Rio, São Paulo, Salvador, Fortaleza, Recife)?
Will you avoid favelas, solo night walks, jewelry/displaying valuables, and use Uber/taxis only?
Traveling in a group, staying in well-reviewed central hotels, during daylight mostly?

yes.advice: Medium risk: Proceed with extreme vigilance. Use ATM inside banks, guard belongings, have robbery plan (comply, don't resist). Level: Caution.

no.advice: High risk: Strongly reconsider or limit exposure. Hire private security/guides. Level: Reconsider.
Very high risk: Do not visit these areas without professional protection. Level: Avoid.

no.question: Visiting beaches/Northeast coast or rural areas (e.g., Pantanal, Amazon)?

yes.question: Activities include hiking/boating in remote areas or Carnival/high-tourist seasons?
Vaccinated for yellow fever, hepatitis; using DEET/mosquito nets; insured for evacuations?

yes.advice: Medium risk: Watch for petty theft, rip currents, wildlife. Travel with guides, avoid isolated spots. Level: Caution.

no.advice: Elevated health/environmental risk: Get vaccinated first or postpone. Level: Prepare or avoid.
Lower risk: Standard precautions suffice (sun protection, hydration). Level: Safe.

no.question: Any travel during rainy season (Dec-Mar) or events with crowds (e.g., World Cup, elections)?

yes.advice: Monitor floods/protests: Have flexible plans, avoid demonstrations. Level: Variable caution.

no.advice: Low risk overall: Follow basics (insurance, copies of docs). Level: Safe.

response.summary: A 7-day itinerary for a solo traveler exploring Vancouver's natural wonders, urban culture, and outdoor adventures, optimized for flexibility and moderate pacing.
assumptions: Travel occurs in summer (June-August) for mild weather and full attraction availability.
Moderate daily budget of CAD 200-350 excluding accommodation, covering meals, transit, and entry fees.
Central downtown accommodation for easy access via public transit (TransLink).

Experienced traveler comfortable with walking, biking, and self-guided activities.
response.uncertainty_notes: Attraction hours, shuttle availability (e.g., Grouse Mountain), and weather are seasonal and subject to change; popular sites like Capilano may require advance booking during peak times.
next_steps: Verify personal entry eligibility and apply for eTA/visa via official Government of Canada site (ircc.gc.ca) at least 72 hours before travel.
Book accommodation in downtown Vancouver and YVR airport transfers.
Reserve timed tickets for Capilano Suspension Bridge, Grouse Mountain, and Vancouver Aquarium.
Download TransLink app for transit and purchase a Compass Card.
verification_steps: Check current entry requirements, including any health/testing rules, on canada.ca/travel or CBSA website.
Confirm attraction hours and closures on official sites (e.g., stanleypark.ca, capbridge.com).
Verify TransLink schedules and Seabus/ferry operations via translink.ca.
Review local weather and events on tourismvancouver.com closer to dates.

payload.title: 7-Day Vancouver Itinerary for Solo Explorers

trip_days.summary: Arrival and downtown orientation: Gastown and waterfront highlights.

items.activity: Arrive at YVR, take Canada Line SkyTrain to downtown (25 min), check into hotel, freshen up.
Wander Gastown: See Steam Clock, street art, grab lunch at a local cafe.
Explore Canada Place, watch seaplanes, optional FlyOver Canada ride.
Dinner and sunset stroll in trendy Yaletown.

trip_days.summary: Immerse in Stanley Park's nature and beaches.

items.activity: Rent bike, cycle Seawall to Prospect Point, visit totem poles.
Vancouver Aquarium exhibits and sea otters.
Relax at Third Beach, swim if warm.
Dinner in West End, people-watch.

trip_days.summary: Granville Island markets and Kitsilano vibes.

items.activity: Aquabus ferry to Granville Island Public Market, sample local foods, artisan shops.
Walk to Kitsilano Beach, yoga or beach read.
Brewery tasting or casual dinner.

trip_days.summary: North Shore thrills: Suspension bridges and mountain views.

items.activity: Seabus to Lonsdale Quay Market for breakfast.
Capilano Suspension Bridge Park: Treetops Adventure, Cliffwalk.
Grouse Mountain: Skyride gondola, Lumberjack Show, optional Grind hike.

trip_days.summary: Cultural immersion: Science, Chinatown, and gardens.

items.activity: Science World interactive exhibits and OMNIMAX.
Chinatown tour, Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Classical Chinese Garden.
Dim sum dinner.

trip_days.summary: University area and coastal trails.

items.activity: Museum of Anthropology: First Nations art and totem hall.
Spanish Banks beach walk, kite watching.
Sunset at Jericho Beach Park.

trip_days.summary: Leisure shopping, reflection, and departure.

items.activity: Pacific Centre or Robson Street shopping, souvenirs.
Light lunch, optional Queen Elizabeth Park views.
Return to YVR via Canada Line (allow 3+ hours pre-flight).

response.summary: A 7-day ultra-budget itinerary for San Francisco, designed for a college student on their first international trip. Emphasizes free attractions, walking, public transit (under $10/day), and cheap eats (under $20/day), totaling ~$250-350 excluding accommodation and flights.
assumptions: 7-day trip duration with flexible dates in shoulder season (e.g., spring/fall) for lower costs and fewer crowds.
Total on-trip budget: $50/day max for food, transit, misc.; accommodation in budget hostel (~$40-60/night) booked separately.
Arrival at SFO airport; user has valid ESTA/visa and basic travel insurance.
Staying centrally (e.g., Union Square or Mission District hostel) for walkability.
User comfortable with walking 10+ miles/day and using apps like Google Maps/Transit.
No dietary restrictions; focuses on street food, markets, grocery stores.
response.uncertainty_notes: Public transit fares/routes, attraction hours, and weather (foggy/chilly) can change; free walking tours/events may require advance signup via apps like GuruWalk. Specific prices and schedules are approximate and subject to change; verify closer to dates as SF has frequent updates.
next_steps: Book budget hostel (e.g., HI San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf or Green Tortoise) with free cancellation.
Get Clipper Card/app for transit discounts; load sufficient funds (~$20-30).
Download offline maps, Transit app, and AllTrails for walks.
Hunt flight deals and monitor Google Flights; aim for budget RT fares.
Buy cheap SIM/eSIM (e.g., Mint Mobile) at SFO or Walmart for data.
verification_steps: Check sfmta.com/muni and bart.gov for current fares, schedules, routes, and disruptions.
Visit nps.gov/goga for Golden Gate Bridge/Park hours and closures.
Confirm free attraction details on sftravel.com or official sites (e.g., Chinatown info).
Verify hostel check-in times and any student discounts.
Monitor sfgov.org for events, protests, or street closures.
Check ferrybuildingmarketplace.com for current farmers market schedule.

payload.title: 7-Day Ultra-Budget San Francisco Itinerary for College Students

trip_days.summary: Arrival, settle in, explore downtown and Chinatown on foot (transit: under $10).

items.activity: Arrive SFO, take BART to Powell St Station (check current fare for cheapest option). Clear customs.
Check into hostel, drop bags. Grab budget coffee/breakfast at nearby market.
Free walking tour of Union Square, shops, street performers. Window shop, people-watch.
Walk to Chinatown (1 mile), explore gates, alleys, markets. Free dim sum samples if available.
Cheap eats like pho or burrito (under $10). Relax at hostel.

trip_days.summary: Embarcadero waterfront and Ferry Building (walking + bus under $5).

items.activity: Walk/bus to Embarcadero. Free views of Bay Bridge, sea lions at Pier 39 (skip paid attractions).
Ferry Building farmers market (check schedule for market days; free samples, budget lunch ~$5-8 like bread/cheese).
Stroll piers, Cupid's Span sculpture. Optional free yoga if scheduled.
Return via Muni (check fare). Grocery dinner (under $10).

trip_days.summary: Fisherman's Wharf and North Beach (bus/walk under $5).

items.activity: Muni bus to Wharf. Free street performers, sea lions at Pier 39.
Budget clam chowder in bread bowl (under $10, share if possible).
Walk to North Beach: City Lights Bookstore (free browsing), Washington Square Park.
Free Coit Tower viewpoint (walk up, skip elevator). Budget pizza slice.

trip_days.summary: Golden Gate Bridge epic walk (bus/bike rental alt under $10).

items.activity: Bus to bridge vista point (check route/fare).
Free 3-mile roundtrip walk across bridge (weather permitting; stunning views).
Bus to Lands End for free coastal trail hike (cliffs, Sutro Baths ruins).
Return bus. Budget dinner like In-N-Out or market (under $10).

trip_days.summary: Golden Gate Park and Haight-Ashbury (bus under $5).

items.activity: Bus to park (check route). Free gardens, bison paddock, de Young Museum exterior.
Budget picnic lunch from grocery (under $10; eat in park).
Bus to Haight: Hippie history walk, murals, vintage shops (window shop).
Cheap taqueria (under $10). Hostel chill.

trip_days.summary: Mission District murals and eats (walking under $3 transit).

items.activity: Bus or BART to 16th St Mission. Self-guided mural tour (Clarion Alley, Balmy Alley).
Budget mission burrito (under $10, best value).
Dolores Park for people-watching, free views of city.
Evening walk back, budget street food (under $10).

trip_days.summary: Departure day: Painted Ladies, free museum, airport (transit under $10).

items.activity: Bus to Alamo Square for Painted Ladies photo op.
Free Cable Car Museum (history, models).
Budget lunch wrap (under $10).
BART to SFO (check current fare). Buffer for international flight.

response.summary: Efficient 7-day Florence itinerary for time-constrained business travelers, prioritizing entry procedures, Renaissance sites, and flexibility within moderate budget.
assumptions: US citizen traveler (typically visa-free for <90 days; passport valid 3+ months beyond stay).
Spring timeframe (typically mild weather 10-20°C).
Arrival/departure via Florence (FLR) or Pisa (PSA) airport; frequent flyer miles for flights (approx. $800-1200 RT economy).
Central hotel (e.g., near Duomo, approx. €110-160/night x6 = ~€700-1000).
Daily budget: approx. €40-60 meals/transport, €15-30 entries; total ~$2500-3200.
No specific business meetings; includes flexible afternoon slots.
response.uncertainty_notes: Entry requirements subject to change (e.g., ETIAS digital pre-approval expected to launch in 2025—verify current status); museum hours/tickets sell out fast in spring; prices, weather, crowds variable; transport strikes common—monitor closely. Availability for timed entries time-sensitive.
next_steps: Check passport validity and renew if needed (allow 6+ weeks processing).
Book flights using frequent flyer points; aim for morning arrival Day 1.
Reserve hotel centrally (e.g., Booking.com, free cancel).

Purchase travel insurance covering business interruptions.

verification_steps: Confirm entry rules on viaggiaresicuri.it or travel.state.gov (ETIAS status, COVID rules).

Verify museum hours/closures on uffizi.it, accademia.org, museo duomo firenze.
Check airport transfers/trains on trenitalia.com or aeroportofirenze.it.
Monitor spring events/strikes via firenzetoday.it or ASI airport apps.
Review US State Department advisories for Italy.

payload.title: 7-Day Florence Spring Break Itinerary for Business Travelers

trip_days.summary: Arrival, acclimation, and light historic center intro. Focus on entry procedures and jet lag recovery.

items.activity: Flight arrival; clear customs/immigration (passport stamp, typically no visa check for US). Taxi/train to hotel (~30min, approx. €25-35).
Hotel check-in, rest, light lunch. Confirm entry docs stored safely.
Gentle walk to Piazza della Repubblica; grab coffee.
Evening stroll Palazzo Vecchio; dinner (pasta/pizza, approx. €15-25).

trip_days.summary: Duomo complex mastery—iconic Florence highlights with climbs for views.

items.activity: Duomo, Baptistery, Bell Tower, Dome climb (pre-booked approx. €20-30 combo). Early to avoid lines.
Lunch nearby (panini, approx. €8-12).
Flexible: work calls or Santa Croce Basilica (approx. €8).
Gelateria break; free time.
Dinner: Tuscan bistecca (approx. €20-30).

trip_days.summary: Uffizi Gallery deep dive—Renaissance art essentials, timed for efficiency.

items.activity: Uffizi Gallery (pre-booked approx. €20-25, Botticelli/Venus). Skip-the-line.
Lunch overlooking Arno River.
Ponte Vecchio bridge, jewelry shops; Oltrarno artisan walk.
Business buffer or aperitivo.

trip_days.summary: Michelangelo's David and Medici legacy—compact north side.

items.activity: Accademia Gallery (pre-booked approx. €15-20, David statue).
San Lorenzo Market, Medici Chapels (approx. €8-12). Lunch (street food approx. €8-12).
Flexible work time or Boboli Gardens if energy allows (approx. €10-15).
Piazza Santa Maria Novella; evening gelato.

trip_days.summary: Half-day trip option or deep Florence—balance rest/work.

items.activity: Train to Pisa (1hr, approx. €10-15 RT)—Leaning Tower photo stop (or skip for work).
Return; Bargello Museum sculptures (approx. €8-12) or co-working.
Sunset Piazzale Michelangelo (bus approx. €1.50); farewell dinner.

trip_days.summary: Free/flex day for business, shopping, or missed sights.

items.activity: Morning market/shop leather goods (budget approx. €50).
Dedicated work block or Brancacci Chapel (approx. €8).
Wine tasting or relax.

trip_days.summary: Departure day—morning wrap-up.

items.activity: Last-minute sights/coffee; hotel checkout.
Transfer to airport (allow 2hrs buffer); reflect on trip.

response.summary: A flexible 7-day itinerary for a digital nomad in Osaka, emphasizing authentic local experiences like street food, hidden neighborhoods, and day trips, with built-in work-friendly time blocks.
assumptions: 7-day trip with arrival on Day 1 morning and departure after Day 7.
Staying centrally in Namba or Umeda for easy access to public transport.
Moderate budget allowing for ICOCA card, occasional taxis, and mid-range meals.
User has basic Japanese navigation skills via apps like Google Translate and Hyperdia.
Non-peak season travel to avoid crowds; flexible schedule accommodates remote work.
Interest in food-heavy experiences (okonomiyaki, takoyaki) and low-key local vibes over major tourist traps.
response.uncertainty_notes: Restaurant hours, temple closures, and festival schedules (e.g., Tenjin Matsuri in July) are seasonal and may change; public transport disruptions possible during typhoon season (Aug-Oct). Verify real-time via apps.
next_steps: Book accommodation in Namba/Umeda via Booking.com or Airbnb with high-speed WiFi.
Purchase ICOCA or Suica IC card at Kansai Airport for seamless transit.
Download offline maps (Google Maps), Hyperdia app, and Tabelog for restaurant reservations.
Secure JR West Kansai Pass if planning multiple day trips.
Check visa/entry requirements and COVID policies via Japan Tourism site.
verification_steps: Confirm attraction hours on official sites: Osaka Castle (osakacastle.net), Sumiyoshi Taisha (sumiyoshitaisha.or.jp).
Verify restaurant availability and menus on Tabelog.jp or Google Reviews.
Check JR train schedules and delays on Hyperdia.com or Jorudan.co.jp.
Monitor weather and events via Japan Meteorological Agency or Visit Osaka app.
Review co-working space availability on WeWork or local cafes via Workfrom app.

payload.title: 7-Day Osaka Itinerary: Local Experiences for Digital Nomads

trip_days.summary: Arrival, settle in Namba, evening immersion in Dotonbori’s neon-lit food scene.

items.activity: Arrive at Kansai Airport (KIX), transfer to city via JR Haruka Express or Nankai Airport Express. Check into accommodation.
Flexible work session at cafe with strong WiFi; grab katsu curry lunch.
items.location: Starbucks Reserve Roastery or local cafe in Namba

items.activity: Stroll Shinsaibashi shopping arcade, browse local fashion and street snacks.
Dotonbori canal walk: takoyaki at Wanaka, okonomiyaki at Chibo, Glico Man photo.

trip_days.summary: Historic Osaka Castle area, parks, and hidden local eateries.

items.activity: Morning work at co-working space or park bench with portable hotspot.
items.location: WeWork Umeda or cafe near Osaka Castle Park

items.activity: Explore Osaka Castle grounds, museum (skip tower if crowded), cherry blossoms if in season.
Lunch at nearby kushikatsu spots, wander Hozenji Yokocho alley for temple and izakaya vibe.
Relax in Osaka Castle Park, people-watch locals picnicking.

trip_days.summary: Umeda skyline views, markets, and modern local life.

items.activity: Work block at high-rise cafe with views.
Umeda Sky Building Floating Garden Observatory for 360° city views.
Lunch at Tenjinbashi-suji Shopping Street (longest arcade in Japan), try local ramen.
Hep Five Ferris wheel, Nakazakicho retro neighborhood for hipster cafes and street art.

trip_days.summary: Shinsekai retro district, kushikatsu crawl, and Tsutenkaku Tower.

items.activity: Extended work session; prepare for food-heavy day.
Shinsekai exploration: Tsutenkaku Tower climb, billboards, local vibe.
Kushikatsu tasting tour (deep-fried skewers) at Yaekatsu or street stalls; rule: no double-dipping!
Evening drinks at local standing bar (tachinomiya).

trip_days.summary: Day trip to Nara for deer park and ancient temples, back for Osaka nightlife.

items.activity: Early train to Nara (30-45 min via JR Yamatoji Line).

Kofuku-ji Temple, local kakinoha-zushi lunch (persimmon leaf sushi).
Return to Osaka, quick work check-in.
Namba yatai (night market stalls) or bar hopping.

trip_days.summary: Southern Osaka shrines, local baths, and relaxed neighborhoods.

items.activity: Work at scenic cafe.
Sumiyoshi Taisha Shrine: arched bridge, serene grounds away from crowds.
Lunch at nearby unagi (eel) specialist, explore residential areas.
Onsen or sento (public bath) experience for local relaxation ritual.

trip_days.summary: Free-form day for shopping, work wrap-up, and departure prep.

items.activity: Final work sprint or souvenir shopping at Kuromon Market (fresh seafood, pickles).
Amerikamura for streetwear, vinyl shops, youth culture.
Farewell meal: high-end okonomiyaki or conveyor-belt sushi.
Transfer to airport/train station; reflect on trip.

response.summary: Time-efficient 3-day SF itinerary for business travelers: cultural/historical sites and local customs.
assumptions: Arrival Friday morning via SFO airport; departure Sunday evening.
Accommodation in Union Square (mid-range hotel within budget).
Public transport via Muni Passport and rideshares; fits moderate budget ($2000-3500).
Moderate walking (3-5 miles/day); a weekend in March 2026.
response.uncertainty_notes: Alcatraz ferries book out 3-6 months ahead; March weather (50-65°F, foggy/rainy possible) may affect outdoor sites; event closures like parades could impact access. Prices for transport, lodging, attractions, and rentals subject to change.
next_steps: Book Alcatraz tickets now via alcatrazcruises.com.
Reserve hotel via Booking.com or similar (Union Square preferred).
Purchase Go City San Francisco Explorer Pass for bundled attractions.

Monitor SF weather and events on visitcalifornia.com closer to March 2026.
Check current rental rates on golden gate bridge concessionaire sites.

payload.title: 3-Day San Francisco Cultural & Historical Weekend Itinerary

trip_days.summary: Friday: Waterfront icons and Chinatown immersion, highlighting maritime history and Asian customs.

items.activity: Arrive SFO, BART to Powell St, check-in Union Square; grab coffee and observe local fast-paced commuter customs (minimal small talk, efficient lines).
Ride historic cable car (follow local etiquette: hold on tight, no eating/drinking); visit Cable Car Museum for engineering history.
Lunch at Boudin Bakery (sourdough bread bowl chowder; tip 15-20% standard).
Explore Pier 39 sea lions, maritime exhibits; learn Wharf's fishing heritage and casual SF tipping customs.
Walk to Chinatown: Portsmouth Square (oldest Chinatown, tai chi customs), Dragon Gate; dim sum tasting (respect queueing, use chopsticks).
Dinner in North Beach (Italian heritage area); evening stroll.

trip_days.summary: Saturday: Alcatraz deep dive and Telegraph Hill views, focusing on prison history and Beat Generation culture.

items.activity: Ferry to Alcatraz Island (audio tour on infamous inmates, escape stories; note park rules: stay on paths).
Lunch at Fog Harbor (sustainable seafood; SF eco-conscious customs).
Bus/walk to Coit Tower; murals depict 1930s Depression-era SF life, panoramic views.
Explore North Beach: City Lights Bookstore (Beat poetry hub), learn counterculture customs.
Free time or Barbary Coast history walk; dinner nearby.

trip_days.summary: Sunday: Golden Gate and counterculture districts before departure, blending engineering marvels with hippie history.

items.activity: Bus to Golden Gate Bridge; walk/bike across (rentals available), learn 1937 construction history and fog etiquette.
Lunch at Presidio picnic (grab provisions; enjoy outdoor SF customs).
Presidio history: explore forts, WWII exhibits; optional Lands End trail.
Bus to Haight-Ashbury: Victorian houses, Grateful Dead history, 1960s Summer of Love customs (free-spirited vibe).
Return to Union Square via Muni; depart to SFO.

payload.title: 7-Day Safe Budget Itinerary for First-Time NYC Visitors

trip_days.summary: Arrival, orientation in safe Midtown; focus on settling in and basic safety acclimation

items.activity: Arrive at airport, take AirTrain/subway to Midtown (avoid yellow cabs for budget). Check into hostel. Unpack and review safety rules: keep valuables hidden, use hotel safe.
Buy MetroCard at station. Subway safety intro: stand behind yellow line, travel in groups during rush hour, keep bag in front.
Walk Times Square (daytime only). People-watch safely on main paths; avoid street vendors pushing items.
Budget lunch (street hot dog ~$3). Return to hostel early; rest and plan via free WiFi.
Early dinner at hostel or cheap deli (~$10). Avoid nightlife on first night.

trip_days.summary: Central Park exploration; safe green space with picnic budget lunch

items.activity: Enter park from south (59th St). Walk paths to Bethesda Terrace; stay on lit trails, aware of surroundings.
Picnic lunch (buy groceries from nearby Trader Joe's ~$10). Sit in open areas.
Visit zoo or Belvedere Castle (free exterior). Exit before dusk.
Subway back to Midtown. Review day photos.

trip_days.summary: High Line and Chelsea; elevated safe walk with market eats

items.activity: Subway to High Line (elevated park, very safe). Walk full length north-south.
Lunch at Chelsea Market (samples/tacos ~$12). Crowded but secure area.
Explore Hudson Yards (free exterior views of Vessel). Avoid isolated spots.
Return via subway before dark.

trip_days.summary: Lower Manhattan memorials; daytime history with transit tips

items.activity: Subway to 9/11 Memorial (free). Reflective visit; respectful crowds.
Budget falafel nearby (~$8).
Walk to Battery Park; view Statue of Liberty from shore (free).
Subway uptown. Practice rush-hour etiquette.

trip_days.summary: Upper East Side museums and walks; free cultural day

Picnic in nearby park (~$10 groceries).
Stroll Museum Mile safely.
Return to hostel.

trip_days.summary: Brooklyn day trip; safe bridge walk and views

DUMBO views and pizza slice (~$5). Stay in tourist zones.
Explore Brooklyn Heights Promenade (safe waterfront).
Subway back before night.

trip_days.summary: Free morning, departure; reflection and buffer

items.activity: Light revisit of favorite spot or shopping (souvenirs ~$10).

response.summary: A budget-friendly 7-day itinerary for Kyoto, Japan, tailored for college students on their first international trip. Focuses on free/low-cost attractions, efficient public transport, and affordable eats under $50/day excluding lodging.
assumptions: 7-day trip with flexible dates (avoid peak seasons like cherry blossoms for lower costs)
Daily budget $40-60 USD (transport, food, entries; excludes flights/accommodation)
Staying in central hostel/hostel (e.g., near Kyoto Station, ~$25/night)
Using ICOCA card or 1-day bus pass (700 JPY/~$5) for transport
Basic Japanese phrases or translation app; vegetarian/flexible eating
Moderate walking fitness; first trip, so includes money-saving tips
response.uncertainty_notes: Temple/shrine hours and crowds vary by season/weather; some free sites may charge small fees during festivals. Check yen exchange rates as they fluctuate.

Get travel insurance covering Japan; exchange minimal cash or use fee-free ATM (7-Eleven)

verification_steps: Check official Kyoto tourism site (kyoto.travel) for current hours/closures

payload.title: 7-Day Budget Kyoto Itinerary for College Students

trip_days.summary: Arrival day: Settle in, explore Kyoto Station area and free Nijo Castle grounds. Focus on rest and orientation.

items.activity: Arrive at Kansai Airport/Kyoto Station, buy ICOCA card, check into hostel. Walk around station for free people-watching.
Visit Nijo Castle outer gardens (free), budget dinner at conbini (convenience store).
Early night; total spend ~$10 (transport/food).

trip_days.summary: Iconic free shrine hike: Fushimi Inari Taisha. Southern Kyoto exploration via bus.

items.activity: Bus to Fushimi Inari (free entry), hike torii gates (2-3hrs, pack water/snacks).
Lunch at nearby udon shop (~500 JPY).
Bus to Tofuku-ji Temple (free grounds), walk back. Buy 1-day bus pass.
Ramen dinner (~800 JPY). Total ~$15.

trip_days.summary: Western Kyoto: Bamboo grove and monkeys. Nature-focused, low-cost.

items.activity: Bus/train to Arashiyama Bamboo Grove (free), Tenryu-ji outer paths.
Picnic lunch from conbini; hike to Iwatayama Monkey Park (400 JPY entry).
Stroll riverside, return by bus. Total ~$12.

trip_days.summary: Northern highlights: Golden Pavilion and Philosopher's Path. Bus-efficient.

items.activity: Bus to Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion, 400 JPY).
Bus to Philosopher's Path (free walk, Ginkaku-ji outer view). Lunch onigiri.
Explore Nanzen-ji aqueduct (free). Total ~$10.

trip_days.summary: Eastern Kyoto: Gion geisha district and temples. Evening vibes.

items.activity: Bus to Kiyomizu-dera (400 JPY), walk Higashiyama streets.
Budget katsu curry lunch.
Yasaka Shrine (free), Gion stroll for geisha spotting. Total ~$12.

trip_days.summary: Markets and chill: Nishiki food market, Imperial Palace. Shop smart.

items.activity: Nishiki Market (free entry, sample cheap street food ~500 JPY).
Walk to Imperial Palace grounds (free, no interior).
Souvenir hunt (under 1000 JPY), farewell ramen. Total ~$15.

trip_days.summary: Departure day: Light morning activity, head to airport.

items.activity: Free time or revisit favorite spot; conbini breakfast.
Train to Kansai Airport (ICOCA). Total ~$10.

payload.title: 4-Day San Francisco Local Customs Itinerary for Business Travelers

trip_days.summary: Arrival and Financial District/Embarcadero: Experience tech hustle, ferry culture, and sourdough traditions.

Evening walk in SoMa; witness tech after-work scene at coffee shops, practicing casual SF networking chats.

trip_days.summary: Chinatown and North Beach: Dive into Asian-American customs, dim sum rituals, and Italian heritage.

items.activity: North Beach stroll; enjoy Italian coffee culture at Caffe Trieste, birthplace of SF beat poetry readings.

trip_days.summary: Mission District: Explore Latino murals, taqueria customs, and vibrant street art scene.

items.activity: Mission Murals tour (self-guided); appreciate local tagging customs and photo etiquette (ask permission).
Super burrito at taqueria; master SF Mission-style burrito wrapping and al pastor ordering.
Evening at 24th St.; observe family gatherings and live music customs in taqueria plazas.

trip_days.summary: Castro and Haight-Ashbury: LGBTQ+ history, hippie vibes, and counterculture shopping customs.

items.activity: Metro Line 2 from Haeundae to Gwangan Station (~20min).
Gwangalli Beach (kite surfers, cafes; very safe).
Lunch with Gwangan Bridge view.
Stroll beach promenade; watch bridge light show prep (daytime safe).

trip_days.summary: Colorful Gamcheon Culture Village, accessible by bus.

items.activity: Bus 10 or Metro Line 1 + bus from Haeundae to Gamcheon (~1hr, direct tourist routes).
Explore village alleys, art installations (crowded, guided paths).
Lunch at village cafes.
Return to Haeundae; relax.

trip_days.summary: Markets and waterfront in Nampo-dong, vibrant daytime area.

items.activity: Metro Line 2 to Jagalchi Station (~40min).
Jagalchi Fish Market (fresh seafood, tourist section safe).
Lunch: Sashimi or market eats.
BIFF Square and Gukje Market (street food, shopping, high traffic).

trip_days.summary: Coastal temple and Busan Tower for views.

items.activity: Bus 101 from Haeundae to Haedong Yonggungsa (~1hr, scenic route).
Visit oceanfront temple (popular, safe paths).
Lunch nearby.
Metro to Busan Tower (Yongdusan Park, central park safe).

trip_days.summary: Free time, shopping, and departure.

items.activity: Free time: Souvenir shopping in Haeundae (department stores safe).
items.location: Haeundae Shinsegae Centum City (optional mall visit)

items.activity: Lunch.
Relax or last-minute beach walk.
Metro/Limousine Bus to airport (~1hr); depart.

prompt:
You are an expert travel planning assistant creating a day-by-day itinerary.

User Profile: College student, limited budget, first international trip
Trip Context: Planning a trip with flexible dates and budget
Destination: Sao Paulo, Brazil
Category: budgeting
Difficulty: medium

Create a detailed day-by-day itinerary in JSON format matching the response envelope schema.

Envelope (root-level fields; same level as payload_type and payload):
- "summary": string (brief overview of the trip)
- "assumptions": array of strings
- "uncertainty_notes": string
- "next_steps": array of strings
- "verification_steps": array of strings
- "payload_type": "itinerary"
- "payload": object (the itinerary)

Requirements:
1. Output must be valid JSON with all envelope fields at the ROOT level (not inside payload)
2. Set "payload_type": "itinerary"
3. Fill the "payload" field with an itinerary object containing:
   - "title": string (e.g. "7-day Cusco itinerary")
   - "trip_days": array of day objects, each with:
     - "day": integer (1-indexed)
     - "summary": string (brief summary of the day)
     - "items": array of activity objects with "time_block" (e.g. "09:00-12:00"), "activity", "location" (optional)
4. Include "summary" field with brief trip overview
5. Include "assumptions" field (array) - state any assumptions about travel dates, budget, or preferences
6. Include "uncertainty_notes" field (string) - mention if timing/availability is time-sensitive or may change
7. Include "next_steps" field (array) - suggest concrete actions the user should take
8. Include "verification_steps" field (array) - recommend checking official sources for time-sensitive info (hours, closures, etc.)

Output JSON only. No prose. No markdown.

response.summary: 7-day budget itinerary for Sao Paulo, Brazil, tailored for college student on first international trip.
assumptions: 7-day trip duration with flexible dates.
Daily budget: $30-40 USD per person (food, transport, entries).
Staying in affordable central areas like Republica, Liberdade, or Pinheiros (hostel ~$15-25/night).
Arrival morning of Day 1; departure evening of Day 7.
Moderate fitness level for walking; using metro/bus with Bilhete Único card (~$5-10/day depending on usage).
Basic Portuguese via app; vegetarian-friendly street food options.
response.uncertainty_notes: Attraction hours/events/prices/fares may vary by season/holidays/strikes (e.g., free museum days); check public transport disruptions. Weather (rainy Nov-Mar) could impact outdoor plans. All ~ prices are approximate 2024 estimates; currency fluctuates (1 USD ~5.6 BRL).
next_steps: Book hostel in Liberdade/Republica via Hostelworld (under $25/night).
Buy international SIM/eSIM for data (~$10 for 7 days).
Get travel insurance covering health/theft.
Download Google Maps (offline), Google Translate, and Moovit app for transport.
Purchase Bilhete Único card at metro stations upon arrival.
verification_steps: Check SPTrans website/app for current metro/bus schedules, Bilhete Único fares, and airport transfers.
Visit saopauloparacriancas.com.br or turismo.sp.gov.br for attraction hours/closures/fees.
Confirm free entry days (e.g., MASP Tuesdays) on official museum sites like masp.org.br.
Monitor weather via AccuWeather and travel advisories on US State Dept site.
Verify current prices via Numbeo.com for Sao Paulo costs.

payload.title: 7-Day Budget Sao Paulo Itinerary for First-Time College Traveler

trip_days.summary: Arrival, settle in, explore historic center on foot/metro. Focus: orientation, cheap eats.

items.activity: Arrive at GRU airport, take budget Airport Bus to center (~$9, 1hr). Buy Bilhete Único, check into hostel.
Walk Pateo do Collegio (free Jesuit founding site), visit Sao Bento Monastery (free guided tours). Lunch: coxinha street food (~$1-2).
See Cathedral da Se (free), Mercado Municipal for cheap pastel (~$2-3). Safety tip: stick to main streets.
Metro to hostel area, dinner at padaria (bakery, ~$3-4). Rest early due to jetlag.

trip_days.summary: Avenida Paulista: modern vibe, free museums/parks. Use metro.

items.activity: Metro to Brigadeiro station. Stroll Avenida Paulista, people-watch, street performers (free).
Free entry to Casa das Rosas (garden/museum if Tue-Sun). Lunch: nearby lanche (~$2-3).
MASP museum (free Tuesdays, otherwise ~$7). Nearby Japan House (free exhibits). Feira views if weekend.
Sunset at Trianon-Masp park entrance. Dinner: self-catered from supermarket (~$3-4).

trip_days.summary: Ibirapuera Park: nature, art, cycling. Rent bike cheaply.

items.activity: Metro to Vila Mariana. Rent bike (~$5/hr) or walk huge park. See lakes, bridges (free).
Picnic lunch from street vendors (~$2-3). Visit free Afro Brasil Pavilion.
MAM museum (free Saturdays, otherwise low fee) or more park trails. Relax, people-watch.
Metro back, dinner: feijoada at boteco (~$5-6, shareable).

trip_days.summary: Liberdade (Little Tokyo): culture, street art, cheap Asian food.

items.activity: Metro to Liberdade. Explore Japanese district, gardens, street festival (weekends free).
Lunch: sushi combo or yakisoba (~$4-5). Metro to Pinacoteca Luz (~$5, Wed free).
Street art walk in Bexiga/Bela Vista (free guided apps).
Dinner: temaki (~$2-3). Evening lantern festival if weekend.

trip_days.summary: Museums and street art on a budget. Focus: free/cheap culture.

items.activity: Metro to Luz station. Estação da Luz (free architecture/train museum).
Lunch at nearby cafe (~$3-4). Museu do Futebol (~$6, soccer history).
Vila Madalena street art tour (free, Beco do Batman alley).
Happy hour cachaça tasting (~$4-5), bus/metro back.

trip_days.summary: Markets, food tour, relax. Shop souvenirs cheaply.

items.activity: Feira da Benedito Calixto (Sat: antiques/crafts, free entry, bargains ~$5).
Lunch: market empadas/pastel (~$2-3). Haggle for souvenirs.
Free park time or planetarium show at Ibirapuera (check hours/fees). Relax in hostel.
Final dinner: churrasco por kilo (~$7-8, budget spots). Reflect on trip.

trip_days.summary: Light morning, departure. Buffer for shopping/transport.

items.activity: Last-minute free walk or cafe (~$2 coffee). Pick up cheap souvenirs.
Lunch to-go (~$2-3). Metro/bus to airport (~$9).
Arrive airport 3hrs early. Safe travels!

   - "title": string (e.g. "7-day Cusco itinerary")
   - "trip_days": array of day objects, each with:
     - "day": integer (1-indexed)
     - "summary": string (brief summary of the day)
     - "items": array of activity objects with "time_block" (e.g. "09:00-12:00"), "activity", "location" (optional)
4. Include "summary" field with brief trip overview
5. Include "assumptions" field (array) - state any assumptions about travel dates, budget, or preferences
6. Include "uncertainty_notes" field (string) - mention if timing/availability is time-sensitive or may change

response.summary: A 7-day budget itinerary for Busan, South Korea, designed for a college student's first international trip. Focuses on affordable public transport, free/cheap attractions, street food, and easy entry guidance.
assumptions: 7-day trip arriving at Gimhae International Airport via budget flight.
Daily budget: 50,000-70,000 KRW (excluding flights/accommodation), using T-money card for transport.
Staying in central budget hostel (e.g., Seomyeon or Haeundae, ~20,000 KRW/night).
Travel in shoulder season (spring/fall) for lower costs and mild weather.
User eligible for K-ETA or visa-free entry (most nationalities, 90 days).
response.uncertainty_notes: Attraction hours, ferry schedules, and market availability may vary by season/weather; entry requirements (K-ETA validity) can change—apply 72+ hours before travel.
next_steps: Apply for K-ETA at k-eta.go.kr (free/10,000 KRW, valid 2 years).
Book flights and hostel (Hostelworld/Airbnb).
Get T-money card (reloadable for buses/subways).
Download apps: Naver Map, Papago (translator), Visit Busan.
Buy travel insurance covering medical/evacuation.
verification_steps: Confirm K-ETA/visa on hhikorea.go.kr or embassy site.
Check hours/closures on english.visitbusan.com.
Verify transport schedules via Busan Metro app.
Monitor COVID/entry rules on Korea CDC site.

payload.title: 7-Day Budget Busan Itinerary for First-Time College Travelers

trip_days.summary: Arrival, settle in Seomyeon, light exploration, and entry prep review.

items.activity: Arrive at Gimhae Airport, buy T-money card (3,000 KRW), take bus/subway to Seomyeon (1,500 KRW, 1hr). Review K-ETA/passport.
Check into hostel, rest, unpack.
Lunch at street food stalls (kalguksu noodles ~5,000 KRW), explore Seomyeon underground shopping mall (free).
Visit Lotte Department Store rooftop (free views), people-watch.
Dinner (bibimbap ~7,000 KRW), evening walk.

trip_days.summary: Haeundae Beach area—relaxed beach day with free coastal walks.

items.activity: Subway to Haeundae (1,500 KRW).
Beach walk, swim (free), picnic lunch (convenience store kimbap ~3,000 KRW).
Stroll Haeundae Market for snacks (hoetjip fish cakes ~4,000 KRW), beachfront views.
Sunset at beach, return to Seomyeon for cheap dinner.

trip_days.summary: Gamcheon Culture Village—colorful murals and hikes (budget photo ops).

items.activity: Bus/subway to Gamcheon (1,800 KRW).
Explore village murals, alleys (entry 2,000 KRW), light hike, lunch at cafe (~6,000 KRW).
More photos, rooftop views, return.
Seomyeon street food dinner.

trip_days.summary: Jagalchi Market and harbor—fresh seafood on a budget.

items.activity: Subway to Jagalchi (1,500 KRW).
Tour market (free), sample sashimi/small seafood (~10,000 KRW/person).
Yongdusan Park & Busan Tower (view deck 12,000 KRW optional—skip for budget).
Harbor walk, return for dinner.

trip_days.summary: Temples and views—cultural day with Haedong Yonggungsa.

items.activity: Bus to temple (1,800 KRW).
Explore seaside temple (free), ocean views, picnic lunch.
Bus to Beomeosa Temple area (hike trails, free entry).
Return, Seomyeon dinner.

trip_days.summary: Free day—markets, optional ferry, relaxation.

items.activity: Gukje Market shopping (free browsing, souvenirs <10,000 KRW).
Lunch (tteokbokki ~5,000 KRW), BIFF Square street art.
Optional budget ferry to nearby island (if ~10,000 KRW roundtrip).
Farewell dinner, pack.

trip_days.summary: Departure day—morning activity, airport transfer.

items.activity: Last Seomyeon coffee/snack (~4,000 KRW), checkout.
Subway/bus to airport (1,500 KRW).
Arrive airport 3hrs early, depart.

- "assumptions": array of strings
- "uncertainty_notes": string
- "next_steps": array of strings
- "verification_steps": array of strings
- "payload_type": "itinerary"
- "payload": object (the itinerary)

Requirements:
1. Output must be valid JSON with all envelope fields at the ROOT level (not inside payload)
2. Set "payload_type": "itinerary"
3. Fill the "payload" field with an itinerary object containing:
   - "title": string (e.g. "7-day Cusco itinerary")
   - "trip_days": array of day objects, each with:
     - "day": integer (1-indexed)
     - "summary": string (brief summary of the day)
     - "items": array of activity objects with "time_block" (e.g. "09:00-12:00"), "activity", "location" (optional)
4. Include "summary" field with brief trip overview
5. Include "assumptions" field (array) - state any assumptions about travel dates, budget, or preferences
6. Include "uncertainty_notes" field (string) - mention if timing/availability is time-sensitive or may change
7. Include "next_steps" field (array) - suggest concrete actions the user should take
8. Include "verification_steps" field (array) - recommend checking official sources for time-sensitive info (hours, closures, etc.)

Output JSON only. No prose. No markdown.

response.summary: A 7-day safe, comfort-focused itinerary for a retired couple in Johannesburg, emphasizing secure neighborhoods, guided tours, private transport, and local cuisine within moderate budget.
assumptions: 7-day trip with arrival on Day 1 and departure on Day 8 morning.
Base in Sandton for safety and comfort (mid-range hotel).
Private transfers/Uber used exclusively; no public transport.
Moderate budget sufficient for accommodation, meals, tours/transport.
Guests have moderate mobility; all activities low-exertion.
Focus on safe areas; guided tours for cultural sites.
response.uncertainty_notes: Attraction hours, restaurant availability, guided tour schedules, hotel rates, and market days may change seasonally, due to events, or economic factors; current safety conditions in Johannesburg can fluctuate—prioritize Level 2 advisories.
next_steps: Book accommodation in Sandton (e.g., via Booking.com).
Reserve guided tours (e.g., Soweto via GetYourGuide) and private airport transfers.
Purchase travel insurance covering medical evacuation.
Download Uber app and offline maps for Johannesburg.
verification_steps: Check latest travel advisories from US State Department or equivalent (e.g., STEP alerts).
Verify opening hours, market schedules, and safety protocols for attractions like Apartheid Museum via official websites.
Confirm tour operator reviews and safety records on TripAdvisor or Viator.
Monitor restaurant hours, hotel rates, and availability on Google Maps, Booking.com, or official sites closer to travel dates.

payload.title: 7-Day Safe and Culinary Johannesburg Itinerary for Comfort-Seekers

trip_days.summary: Arrival, rest, and gentle introduction to Sandton with safe evening dining.

items.activity: Private transfer from airport to Sandton hotel; check-in and rest.
Relaxed dinner of peri-peri chicken and local wines at a secure restaurant.

trip_days.summary: Explore secure Sandton: shopping, art, and South African cuisine tasting.

items.activity: Stroll Nelson Mandela Square; visit Sandton City Mall for souvenirs (Uber within area).
Lunch featuring bobotie and malva pudding at upscale cafe.
Contemporary art gallery visit (low-key, air-conditioned).
items.location: Art gallery in Rosebank (short safe Uber)

trip_days.summary: Guided visit to Apartheid Museum: educational with comfort breaks and braai lunch.

items.activity: Private guided tour of Apartheid Museum (wheelchair accessible).
items.location: Apartheid Museum, Gold Reef City area

items.activity: Lunch: Traditional braai (barbecue) at museum cafe.
Private transfer back to hotel for rest.

trip_days.summary: Guided Soweto township tour: safe, seated transport, focus on cultural food experiences.

items.activity: Half-day guided Soweto tour (minibus, stops at Vilakazi Street, Mandela House).
Lunch: Bunny chow and kota street food tasting (sanitized vendor via guide).
Return via private transfer; hotel relaxation.

trip_days.summary: Rosebank day: markets, African cuisine, and relaxed shopping.

items.activity: Local market (check operating days, e.g., weekend): sample Cape Malay dishes.
Lunch: Seafood and potjiekos (stew) at trendy spot.
Browse Design Quarter shops (comfortable walking).

trip_days.summary: Constitution Hill and Parkhurst dining: history with fine local fare.

items.activity: Guided tour of Constitution Hill (old fort/prison, accessible paths).
Lunch: Biltong platters and chakalaka at cafe.
Evening in Parkhurst: dinner crawl of safe bistros (Uber).

trip_days.summary: Light morning activity, farewell meal, and departure prep.

items.activity: Optional spa/massage at hotel for relaxation.
Brunch: Pap and vleis (maize porridge with meat) tasting.
Free time/packing; private transfer to airport.

- "payload": object (the itinerary)

2. Set "payload_type": "itinerary"
3. Fill the "payload" field with an itinerary object containing:
   - "title": string (e.g. "7-day Cusco itinerary")
   - "trip_days": array of day objects, each with:
     - "day": integer (1-indexed)
     - "summary": string (brief summary of the day)
     - "items": array of activity objects with "time_block" (e.g. "09:00-12:00"), "activity", "location" (optional)
4. Include "summary" field with brief trip overview
5. Include "assumptions" field (array) - state any assumptions about travel dates, budget, or preferences
6. Include "uncertainty_notes" field (string) - mention if timing/availability is time-sensitive or may change
7. Include "next_steps" field (array) - suggest concrete actions the user should take

response.summary: 7-day Munich itinerary emphasizing easy public transport, biking, and walking for digital nomad local experiences.
assumptions: Travel during shoulder season (spring/fall) for milder crowds and weather suitable for biking/walking.
User based centrally (e.g., near Hauptbahnhof) for easy MVV access; no mobility restrictions.
Flexible budget covers standard transport day passes; prefers authentic neighborhoods over tourist sites.
Digital nomad needs: WiFi spots included for remote work.
response.uncertainty_notes: Transport schedules, fares, bike availability, and weather can fluctuate; peak hours may be crowded. Events like Oktoberfest alter routes. Specific ticket prices and line numbers subject to change.
next_steps: Download MVV app for S-Bahn/U-Bahn/tram planning and purchase Deutschland-Ticket (check current price) or single-day passes.
Book central accommodation (e.g., Airbnb near Sendlinger Tor) and bike rental via Call-a-Bike app.
Check weather forecast and pack comfortable shoes/rain gear.
verification_steps: Verify MVV routes, hours, and fares on mvv-muenchen.de or app for disruptions/strikes.
Confirm current transport ticket prices (e.g., Deutschland-Ticket) on deutschebahn.com or mvv-muenchen.de.
Confirm attraction hours (e.g., markets) on official sites like muenchen.de.
Check bike rental availability and English Garden rules via stadtwerke-muenchen.de.

payload.title: 7-Day Easy Transport Itinerary: Munich Local Experiences

trip_days.summary: Settle in city center: Walk and U-Bahn intro to historic core.

items.activity: Arrive Hauptbahnhof, buy MVV day pass, walk to co-working cafe for setup.
U-Bahn (U4/U5) to Sendlinger Tor, stroll Viktualienmarkt for local picnic.
Walk to Marienplatz, people-watch Glockenspiel; remote work at cafe.
Tram back, evening beer garden walk.

trip_days.summary: English Garden by bike: Relaxed green space exploration.

items.activity: Rent bike via Call-a-Bike app at station.
Cycle along Isar River paths to English Garden, surf watching.
Picnic and work at Chinese Tower beer garden (WiFi spots).
Bike back leisurely, drop-off.

trip_days.summary: Schwabing by tram: Artsy neighborhood vibes.

items.activity: Tram 17/20 from center to Schwabing.
Explore street art, cafes; co-work at local spot.
Visit Pinakotheken museums if interested, or park relax.
Tram back, local dinner.

trip_days.summary: Olympiapark via U-Bahn: Modern history and views.

items.activity: U3 to Olympiazentrum.
Tower ascent for panorama, picnic.
Lake walk, remote work at cafe; optional sea life center.
U-Bahn return.

trip_days.summary: Hauptbahnhof area & markets: Local shopping by foot/S-Bahn.

items.activity: Walk/S-Bahn loops around station markets.
Lunch at Turkish market, co-work.
S-Bahn to Giesing for residential feel.
Return for evening.

trip_days.summary: Isar River by bus/bike: Nature and locals.

items.activity: Bus 135 to river start.
Riverside walk/bike, swimming spots.
Picnic, work at beer garden.
Bus/bike back.

trip_days.summary: Day trip by regional train: Easy escape to Dachau or Starnberg.

items.activity: S2 train to Dachau Memorial (reflective local history).
Self-guided tour, picnic.
Train back, relax.
Wrap-up dinner.
